concepts/determinism.title: Determinism
concepts/determinism.description: Statehouse provides deterministic behavior, which is essential for debugging, testing, and trust.

concepts/replay.title: Replay
concepts/replay.description: Replay is the ability to retrieve the complete history of state changes for an agent in chronological order.

concepts/state-and-events.title: State and Events
concepts/state-and-events.description: Statehouse is built on a simple but powerful model: state is derived from an immutable event log.

concepts/transactions.title: Transactions
concepts/transactions.description: All writes in Statehouse are transactional. Either a state transition happened, or it did not.

concepts/versions.title: Versions
concepts/versions.description: Every write to a key creates a new version. Versions are monotonic counters that enable time-travel queries and versioned reads.

examples/audit-and-replay.title: Audit and Replay
examples/audit-and-replay.description: This example demonstrates using Statehouse for auditing and debugging agent behavior.

examples/reference-agent.title: Reference Agent
examples/reference-agent.description: The repository includes a reference agent implementation demonstrating Statehouse integration.

examples/resume-after-crash.title: Resume After Crash
examples/resume-after-crash.description: This example demonstrates recovering agent state after a crash.

failure-modes/disk-full.title: Disk Full
failure-modes/disk-full.description: This document describes behavior when the storage disk runs out of space.

failure-modes/long-running-transactions.title: Long-Running Transactions
failure-modes/long-running-transactions.description: This document describes behavior with long-running transactions and timeouts.

failure-modes/partial-writes.title: Partial Writes
failure-modes/partial-writes.description: This document explains how Statehouse prevents partial writes from being visible.

failure-modes/process-crash.title: Process Crash
failure-modes/process-crash.description: This document describes behavior when the Statehouse daemon process crashes.

getting-started/first-replay.title: First Replay
getting-started/first-replay.description: Replay your agent's transaction history to see what happened.

getting-started/first-transaction.title: First Transaction
getting-started/first-transaction.description: Write your first state transaction with Statehouse.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: Install Statehouse daemon and Python SDK.

getting-started/running-statehoused.title: Running statehoused
getting-started/running-statehoused.description: The Statehouse daemon (statehoused) is the core state engine. Here's how to run it.

grpc-internals/api-versioning.title: API Versioning
grpc-internals/api-versioning.description: Statehouse uses a versioned API to ensure stability and backward compatibility.

grpc-internals/streaming-replay.title: Streaming Replay
grpc-internals/streaming-replay.description: The Replay RPC uses gRPC server streaming to efficiently deliver event logs.

grpc-internals/why-grpc.title: Why gRPC
grpc-internals/why-grpc.description: Statehouse uses gRPC as its wire protocol. This document explains the rationale.

introduction/design-philosophy.title: Design Philosophy
introduction/design-philosophy.description: Statehouse is built on clear principles that guide its design and development.

introduction/what-is-statehouse.title: What is Statehouse?
introduction/what-is-statehouse.description: Statehouse is a strongly consistent state and memory engine designed for AI agents, workflows, and automation systems.

introduction/when-not-to-use.title: When Not to Use Statehouse
introduction/when-not-to-use.description: Statehouse is intentionally focused. Here are cases where other solutions may be better.

introduction/when-to-use.title: When to Use Statehouse
introduction/when-to-use.description: Statehouse is designed for specific use cases. Here's when it makes sense.

operations/configuration.title: Configuration
operations/configuration.description: Statehouse daemon is configured through environment variables and configuration files.

operations/data-directories.title: Data Directories
operations/data-directories.description: Statehouse stores all persistent data in a single directory.

operations/logging-and-metrics.title: Logging and Metrics
operations/logging-and-metrics.description: Statehouse provides structured logging for observability.

operations/recovery.title: Recovery
operations/recovery.description: Statehouse is designed to recover automatically from crashes and restarts.

operations/snapshots.title: Snapshots
operations/snapshots.description: Snapshots capture the current state for faster recovery after restart.

python-sdk/client.title: Statehouse Client
python-sdk/client.description: The Statehouse class is the main entry point for interacting with the daemon.

python-sdk/errors.title: Error Handling
python-sdk/errors.description: The SDK defines a hierarchy of exceptions for different error conditions.

python-sdk/overview.title: Python SDK Overview
python-sdk/overview.description: The Statehouse Python SDK provides a clean, Pythonic interface for interacting with the Statehouse daemon. All gRPC and protobuf details are hidden from users.

python-sdk/reads.title: Reading State
python-sdk/reads.description: Statehouse provides several methods for reading state.

python-sdk/replay.title: Replay
python-sdk/replay.description: Replay streams the event log for an agent, allowing you to reconstruct state history or audit operations.

python-sdk/transactions.title: Transactions
python-sdk/transactions.description: Transactions group multiple writes and deletes into an atomic unit. Either all operations succeed, or none do.
